title: eight times the browzer screen has gone black
content:

The machine has so far always come back on ok, but once went black soon after I again went on-line. Is this a new problem with Fire Fox or a result of a hack? My browser update always says current. Is there something I can do besides going to chrome? Is this a malware issue? I am on Xfinity so using their modem security.

- - - Bill Noyes

title: Bookmark Mayhem
content: I have Firefox 98.0.1 in 64 Bit on Win7 Pro. I attempted to export via HTML my bookmarks from the 32 bit version into the 64 bit version I'm now using 99% of the time. I imported the HTML file using Manager/Bookmarks/Library and ended up with three Bookmarks Toolbars folders and many bookmarks I don't need. I deleted the unwanted bookmarks, however, they still appear when I click open the "Bookmark" at the top of the browser page. Reboot didn't correct issue, nor Refresh. Ideally, I'd like to delete ALL the bookmarks, using the Manager, and just import the bookmarks from the HTML file I have from the 32 bit. I don't see a complication arising from moving to 64 bit from 32 bit. I've made several attempts to clean this mess up, but no success.

title: Cannot download files, reports "Failed"
content:
When I try to download a file, the download always fails. This happens no matter what website I'm downloading the file from (see screenshot 1).

This started happening within the last week or so. We are running versions 97 and above.

Firefox is configured to always ask where to save files to (see screenshot 2).

Write permissions to the user's Downloads folder is denied for reasons unrelated to this issue (see screenshot 3). When I re-enable write permissions, the problem goes away.

Has anyone else run into this problem? Is write access to the Downloads folder required now, even if Firefox is not configured to save files to that location? Thanks!

title: Search system
content:
I quote all correspondence. And where is the solution, where is the answer?

Александр 14.03.2022, 12:26 more options Why has my default search engine changed and why does Firefox no longer support Yandex? Did you also introduce your own sanctions? Then I say goodbye to you! I think most users from Russia will do the same!

Seburo Top 10 Contributor Moderator 14.03.2022, 13:26 more options HI

Yandex has been removed as optional search providers in the drop-down search menu in Firefox. You can update and/or add search engines at any time in Settings. Click the Menu button, select Settings and click Search.

Александр Задавший вопрос 14.03.2022, 13:42 more options I did all this, I click Search and there is no Yandex. How to add it then?

James Top 25 Contributor Moderator 15.03.2022, 15:24 more options https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/search-engine-removal https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/add-or-remove-search-engine-firefox

You can also add Yandex search if you go to Yandex site and add it to search bar or you can go to https://mycroftproject.com/search-engines.html?name=Yandex

Александр You can also add Yandex search if you go to Yandex site and add it to search bar or you can go to https://mycroftproject.com/search-engines.html?name=Yandex Not true, among the proposed search engines there is no Yandex at all. It has been completely removed from Firefox. And I don't need a separate Yandex search bar, I need Yandex search by default! This is very bad on the part of the developers, it was you who arranged your sanctions against the Russian audience! I will stop using your browser and I think most in Russia will too. I want to hear from the Firefox team, what do they have to say?


Александр 16.03.2022, 23:36 more options Not true, among the proposed search engines there is no Yandex at all. It has been completely removed from Firefox. And I don't need a separate Yandex search bar, I need Yandex search by default! This is very bad on the part of the developers, it was you who arranged your sanctions against the Russian audience! I will stop using your browser and I think most in Russia will too. I want to hear from the Firefox team, what do they have to say?

James Top 25 Contributor Moderator Сегодня в 01:08 more options The Yandex search engine was simply removed as one of the defaults in the Firefox locales that came with it before as different locales have different defaults. Yandex was one of search engine defaults for only Russia, Turkey, Belarus and Kazakhstan. China had Baidu and Google was the main default for rest of the world locales.

I simply said you can still add it back if you want it. You can also still go to the Yandex website to search just same.

The search bar is a bar that you can have a list of search engines to switch between whether you use the defaults or any search engines you add yourself, including Yandex. It is Not a completely separate toolbar if that is what you thought. Look at the article I linked. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/add-or-remove-search-engine-firefox

James Top 25 Contributor Moderator Сегодня в 01:50 more options Also this is a community forum as I am not with Mozilla so Firefox is not my web browser and I never arranged or removed anything. Also the Firefox developers do not have the time to comment in random threads on this forum.

Александр Задавший вопрос Сегодня в 11:03 more options How can it be added back? I didn't find a way. It has been completely removed, and Yandex is not in the choice of search engines. And how to contact the developers? All normal programs have support and feedback. And I have already switched to the default Yandex browser, goodbye Firefox.

Александр Задавший вопрос Сегодня в 11:05 more options This section is called support, which means that specialists who own the issue should answer here.

Seburo Top 10 Contributor Moderator Сегодня в 11:21 more options Thank you for your feedback. It appears that we have already answered your questions, so I am going to close this thread now.

title: Firefox loosing connection
content:
On the Firefox Browser Gmail has been losing its connection every day for the past week in the late afternoon until I go to bed at 2:00 AM. Dropping the tab and restarting it does not work. I happened to require starting my android smart phone and noticed a had 2 Gmails in the inbox but not on my PC. I was able to access them and return replies, so the Gmail service was operating okay. I shut down the Firefox Browser and restarted it and Bravo, Gmail was now connected, proving the problem was in the Browser. I’m using: Version 98.0.1 (64-bit) on a hi end PC with Windows 7 PROMIS

Good Luck!

Richard [removed phone# from public]

title: PDFs opened using, Windows Default application, Always Ask, fails to occur
content:
The behavior of FireFox saving PDF files has changed. I am using WIN10, FireFox 98.0.1 and have it setup to use windows default application and always ask where to save for PDFs.

BEFORE the problem: The PDF opens in Acrobat Pro IX. After clicking save I would be asked, where to save. I select the location to save the PDF. Then after this, subsequent PDFs downloaded would be saved to the last saved location. This process would repeat for a new website PDF load and save. This is the behavior I want now.

NOW with the problem: The PDF opens in Acrobat Pro IX. 1. Immediately, after a reboot, the save icon on Adobe is grayed out. I select save as and point to the desired directory. 2. For any subsequent PDF opened, the Adobe save icon is available. Files are saved to the desktop. 

Please note I believe I once did get a popup asking where to save and I know I selected desktop.  Since that selection I am no longer asked where to save.

Please note I have looked and tried some of the suggestions at: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/cant-download-or-save-files#w_choose-a-different-download-folder

but some of this advice needs to be updated for the new FireFox version--ex no JSON file is found at the file location covered in the advice.

I believe this issue started after the last FireFox update. Please help me restore behavior listed above under “BEFORE the problem”. Thanks.

title: PDFs downloading instead of just opening
content:
I think a recent update must have changed some of the settings on how Firefox handles PDFs. I updated two days ago to 98.0.1.

After the update it would open the PDFs in the same tab as the link even though the "Open links in tabs instead of new windows" option is already selected. This is not practical (e.g., when I'm in Outlook online and want to open a PDF that has been sent to me, it loads it in the same tab as Outlook online).

In order to circumvent that issue, I changed the "Action" in the "Settings" Menu for opening PDFs. The issue above occurred when it was set to "Open in Firefox." I tried changing it to "Always ask"--this is what I had it set to before the update AFAIK--and now it is opening files in a new tab when I select "Open in Firefox" from the pop-up menu, but it also actually saves the files in my "Downloads" folder instead of the "temp" folder where it used to store the files and where they would be deleted by Windows periodically if I didn't manually save them myself. Note that I do have Firefox set to store any downloads in the "Downloads" folder, but up until the update this did not happen for any PDFs I was opening within Firefox or with Acrobat (unless I specifically said "save file").

Can anyone help with figuring out which setting needs to be adjusted? Just to summarize, I would like to be asked where to open my PDF and have Firefox download the file to the "temp" folder.

title: possible phishing link that just led to a blank screen?
content:
Hi, I clicked on a link inside a Facebook message that I now think was probably a phishing link. It didn't lead to a webpage, just to a blank screen. I know that Firefox has some protections, but I'm wondering if clicking on this link could have caused something that might be able to evade those protections.

Security settings I have in Firefox: "strict" tracking protection, delete cookies when Firefox is closed, show alerts about passwords for breached websites, no autofill, clear history when Firefox closes, block pop-up windows, warn when sites try to install add-ons, block dangerous content, query OCSP responder servers to confirm the current validity of certificates, https mode not enabled.

Could something get through those defenses, just from clicking on the link, and could it survive closing Firefox?

I have seen really mixed messages online and thought I'd come straight to the source. Thank you!

J´tentei reinstalar diversas vezes e ocorre o bloqueio automático impedindo o login no site, como devo proceder, uma vez que utilizo a extensão diariamente para trabalhar?

title: Restore previous appearance for Back and Forward buttons
content:
Until the Proton UI, my "Back" button had a circle around it. It had not been colored for some time, but the color of the Active Title Bar extended into the "File, Edit, View" row and the tabs row, so the "Move Tabs Over" arrow was in the colored area of the tabs row. Between the "Move Tabs Over" arrow being in the colored region, and the "Back" button having a circle around it, I could land my mouse on either just by glancing out the corner of my eye, with not needing to apply any 'brain power' to it.

With the new look of the Proton UI, the "Back" button and the "Move Tabs Over" arrow are about the same size and color, with no circle around the "Back" button, or any other way to separate one from the other just glancing out the corner of my eye. I have tried to use it for months, and I can't get used to that, and i am forever clicking on the one when I meant the other. And it's DRIVING ME NUTS!!

Some time ago, the "Back" button was colored, and I liked that even better.

What I really need is a ROUND, COLORED button for the "Back" button.

How can I get it to again give me a colored and circular BACK button?
creator: JeffNLisa

title: Download di files allegati a emails
content: Buongiorno. Utilizzo un PC Widows10, browser Mozilla Firefox e per la posta GMail. Ho un problema con il download di files allegati a emails in arrivo. In fondo alle emails che contengono dei files allegati compare un riquadro che identifica il file (per esempio un PDF) e permette, cliccando sulla freccetta rivolta verso il basso, di scaricare o aprire il file (si apriva un riquadro che dave le opzioni: Scarica, Apri o Salva). Per qualche motivo da qualche giorno questo riquadro pop-up non si presenta più, invece si apre in una nuova scheda una pagina che visualizza il file e permette di fare le stesse operazioni ma per me in modo più macchinoso. C'è un modo per ripristinare il vecchio riquadro pop-up con le tre scelte? Grazie e saluti. Sergio Spinella
creator: spinella.sms

title: I have recently lost the ability to log in to my bank online

I can get to the bank website but when I click on login it goes into buffering mode indefinately. I can log in from a different laptop and I can log in using a different web browser. Anyone know where the glitch is?
creator: ken.bushby01

title: How do you disable update notifications in firefox? v98
content:
Why do you guys keep ignoring your community? You also keep locking threads related to this. Someone comes along, helps provide an answer that doesn't ultimately help at all, and then you archive the thread so we can't come back and tell them "Hey, this doesn't work anymore".

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1343131

This question, provided some interesting information, which I tried to use to disable the crappy update notifications that Mozilla is forcing on us like a catholic priest alone in a room with a child. Its obvious that so many people have posted that they don't want these notifications, especially since you update this piece of crap software every half day it seems like and you insist on slapping us with notifications every 10 minutes.

No one wants to be told there's an update every single time they open firefox. No one wants to be reminded every few hours that firefox is open, that there's an update. An update that probably makes firefox even worse than it was before. Firefox has been dying, its been getting worse for years. Every update strips a little bit more away and makes the whole thing even worse than before and the only reason I still use it, is because its still better than the alternatives however, Mozilla, you are doing your absolute best to destroy Firefox for good. You are probably deliberately doing this too, you probably just don't want to provide this service anymore so you're trying your best to make people leave. Or perhaps you want to go the Microsoft route, and assume all users are morons so you have to tell them what to think, how to think, how their software should behave, remove all function and capability and turn it into that alphabet computer I had when I was 4 years old with the old school SNES-like cartridge for learning games.

Now, I spend a ton more time than I ever should have, using about:config just to try and tweak things you've taken away or changed. Most notably that last thread I linked, and the changes didn't even work. Honestly, maybe I need to disable the update service completely and stay behind on Firefox 98. Its not like Firefox 99 or 100 is gonna be any better. Its not like you still give us security updates, do you? Maybe you do, you just hide them behind forced changes no one wants. "Hmm, update to get security, but also the changes you don't want. Its your fault if you don't update~"
creator: VasVadum

title: Al hacer clic sobre un enlace de descarga no ofrece la opción Abrir
content: Hola. Desde hace unos días, cuando hago clic sobre un archivo de Word, PowerPoint y otros muchos tipos de archivos, no se abre la ventana en la que se ofrecía la opción de Abrir, Abrir en firefox y Descargar. Únicamente se abre la ventana para elegir la carpeta de descarga (ya que lo tengo configurado para preguntar dónde realizar la descarga), pero no puedo abrirlo directamente. He recurrido al artículo de Administrar los diferentes tipos de descargas: https://support.mozilla.org/es/kb/Administrar%20los%20diferentes%20tipos%20de%20archivo#w_cambiar-las-acciones-de-las-descargas Pero es inútil. He intentado Cambiar las acciones de descargas y añadir aplicaciones, pero no funciona porque el tipo de archivo no está en la lista en Aplicaciones Tampoco he podido Añadir nuevas acciones para la descarga, porque no me ofrece la posibilidad. He intentado restablecer las opciones de descarga borrando handlers.json He desinstalado firefox borrando todo rastro de él en el ordenador y cuando vuelvo a instalarlo sigue en la misma situación. Por si fuera un problema de plugins, después de reinstalarlo, no puse ningún plugin y seguía haciendo lo mismo. ¿Qué puedo hacer? Porque si no puedo resolverlo tendré que cambiar de navegador después de estar usando Firefox como predeterminado desde siempre. Un saludo.
creator: ludoronode

title: The connection was reset
content:
The connection to the server was reset while the page was loading. 

   The site could be temporarily unavailable or too busy. Try again in a few moments.    If you are unable to load any pages, check your computer’s network connection.    If your computer or network is protected by a firewall or proxy, make sure that Waterfox is permitted to access the Web.

title: Firefox downloads files to wrong locations
content:
It started about last week - Firefox completely changed its behavior regarding opening files.

How it worked before: When I download a file, I'm being asked if I want to download it, or open it. If I choose download it, it opens a dialog window to ask me where to save it, suggesting Desktop as default choice. If I choose to open the file, it gets downloaded to Temp and opened. Because it's in Temp, the file eventually gets cleaned up by my OS.

How it works now: If I choose to download, it works normally, asks me where to save it, suggests Desktop. When I choose to open the file, it gets downloaded to my Desktop and opened. After that it stays on my Desktop forever, and I have to delete it by hand, which kills the whole point of "open vs download".

How can I restore the previous behavior? It's extremely annoying. Attached are my settings regarding file saving. They haven't been changed, I've had them like this for years.
creator: arturbobik

title: downloading mobi and AZW3 files
content: When I click on a download link for mobi and AZW3 files, I want a box to pop up and ask me whether I want to open or save. I have two different apps on my computer that will open those types of files. I went to this page (https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/change-firefox-behavior-when-open-file) and found some info, but it didn't help me. In the "Adding download actions" section, when I right click on the mobi file that I just downloaded, I don't get the option "Always Open Similar Files" on that little drop down menu that shows up. How do I get Firefox to recognize that I have an app on the computer that will open those files? This problem only started with the new update a few days ago. Before that I always got the box that asked me Open or Save on any ebook download link I clicked on.

title: Cannot access accounts - Access Denied / Warning: Potential Security Risk Ahead
content: I have several different types of accounts that I cannot access via Firefox. But, I can access these through MS Internet Explorer. Firefox is becoming useless to me. The accounts include banking, insurance, travel, government, etc. This has been on ongoing problem for several weeks. I first realized it with an airline more than a year ago. In Firefox, I have tried to delete cookies, to forget about the site. I have tried changing various protection and security switches. Nothing seems to help. Please see the attached screen shots of return messages. Some messages that say it is a problem with the website and I need to contact that administrator. However, I am able to immediately go to MS Internet Explorer and get into the account. I have read community helps and note that other people have these same problems. And, I have read their frustration as nothing seems to help. I would appreciate some advice that works. I like Firefox better than other browsers and do not want to change. Thanks.

title: after updating firefox 97 to 98, no more sound within firefox
content:
I deinstalled firefox 98 completely from my Xubuntu 20.04.4 I then deleted all firefox related things from ~/.cache and ~/.config I rebooted I newly installed Firefox 98 from repository. Firefox 98 still does not produce sounds. Even a local file:///home/rp/Music/testfile.mp3 runs but does not produce audio output (it worked fine in Firefox 97). The Volume display is showing max. value. Firefox is even visible as stream in sound system's Volume Control / Playback (when the mp3 file is running) with 100% On my system, audio works fine with chromium browser as well as all other audio apps - as before. The earlier release Firefox 97 ran fine and produced audio output as it should. Firefox 98 currently runs without additional add-ons (no one installed besides the default Open H264 Video Codec).

What can I do to get Firefox 98 to output sound?

title: Thumbnail preview on taskbar displays in list form
content:
I am running Firefox in 64bit Windows 10 with 16GB ram, intel core processor and more than a TB free on each drive. I currently have two Firefox browser windows open, one with four tabs and the other with seventeen. Ordinarily when I click on the Firefox icon in the taskbar it displays a thumbnail of the two windows and whichever page is active in those windows. Recently, however, it has been displaying all of the open webpages in list format, instead of the thumbnails.

The behavior is inconsistent and I have not been able to determine a pattern, but the list is becoming more common and makes it more difficult to locate the page I was on. The issue began after my data hard-drive crashed, which held certain Firefox files despite the operating system being on another drive. But now that I have replaced the drive, the problem persists and I am not certain the issue was related to the crash at all.

Does anyone know what might be causing this behavior? I have attached screen shots of both the list and thumbnail views I am referring to.
creator: wynden
